items.title: RailTel Corporation shares in focus on winning order worth Rs 78.43 crore
items.description: RailTel Corporation of India Share Price | The share touched a 52-week high of Rs 618.00 and a 52-week low of Rs 301.35 on 12 July, 2024 and 14 March, 2024, respectively. Currently, the stock is trading 34.47 percent below its 52-week high and 34.38 percent above its 52-week low.

items.title: Stock Market LIVE Updates: GIFT Nifty signals a negative start; Asian markets trade lower
items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates:

items.title: First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade
items.description: The GIFT Nifty is indicating a negative start for the day.  Oil was steady in the first session of the new year after an industry report indicated shrinking US crude stockpiles, while gold opened the New Year steady after notching its biggest annual gain since 2010, with traders assessing prospects for a slower pace of monetary easing by the Federal Reserve in 2025.

items.title: Stocks to Watch Today: Tata Motors, Maruti Suzuki, CSB Bank, South Indian Bank, RailTel Corp, NMDC in focus on 2 January
items.description: Stocks To Watch Today, Jan 2: Stocks like Ambuja Cements, Ugro Capital, Ind-Swift Laboratories, Deepak Spinners, Ashoka Metcast, Ruby Mills, Goa Carbon, Indian Bank, Responsive Industries, RNFI Services, Gujarat Toolroom, and Anya Polytech & Fertilizers will be in focus on January 2.

items.title: Trade Spotlight: How should you trade ONGC, United Spirits, Action Construction Equipment, Gland Pharma, Blue Star, and others on January 2?
items.description: Rangebound trading is expected to sustain in the upcoming sessions until the frontline indices give a strong close above all key moving averages. Below are some trading ideas for the near term.

items.title: Sensex nudges higher, Nifty above 23,800 on auto, banking shares; broader markets quiet
items.description: Nifty Auto, FMCG and Infra index gained in the range of 0.5 percent. Auto stocks were buzzing in trade after multiple companies reported their December sales data. The likes of Tata Motors, M&M and Maruti Suzuki kept the index in the green.

items.title: Petronet LNG shares down 5% as Citi note mentions critical view by PNGRB on tariffs
items.description: Natural gas regulator PNGRB has said that the company seems to have made profit at the cost of gas consumers, and is seeking a framework to bring the regassification activities under its purview.

items.title: Sky Gold: Shining growth prospects
items.description: Increasing market share of key clients, growing exports, and foray into new segments like lab-grown diamonds are among the factors working in favour of the company

items.title: Why will water infra stocks be in focus in 2025?
items.description: Spatial shortage makes it crucial for India to manage its water resources judiciously

items.title: Budget Snapshot: STT collections to take a beating thanks to SEBI curbs
items.description: While current STT collections may exceed budget forecasts for this fiscal year, a steep decline in revenue from STT for the next fiscal year is likely due to reduced trading volumes

items.title: CSB Bank shares 3% higher on strong deposit growth, healthy gold loan book
items.description: The business update shared by CSB Bank on January 1 showed that the total deposits grew by 22.17% on year to Rs 33,406 crore, and advances against gold and gold jewellery rose by 36.28% YoY to Rs 13,018 crore.

items.title: Agri Picks Report January 02 2025: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: According to Geojit Financial Services, The Union Cabinet Wednesday approved the continuation of the Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana and Restructured Weather Based Crop Insurance Scheme till 2025-26 (Apr-Mar), with an overall outlay of INR 695.15 billion from FY22 to FY26, the government said in a release.

items.title: Goa Carbon shares rise 6% as company resumes operations at Bilaspur unit
items.description: 'The kiln has been lit, and production has returned to normal from today,' said Goa Carbon on January 1

items.title: South Indian Bank sprints 3% on healthy Q3FY25 business update
items.description: South Indian Bank's gross advances rose by 12 percent YoY to Rs 86,965 crore in Q3

items.title: Sensex jumps 700 pts, Nifty near 24k as auto, IT stocks bolster bullish sentiment; PSU banks suffer
items.description: Meanwhile, the Nifty PSU Bank index led by SBI, Bank of India and Bank of Baroda slipped 1 percent, snapping its two-day gaining streak on the bourses. Other losers included Nifty Pharma and Realty.

items.title: Ashok Leyland jumps 5% as Dec auto sales beat Street estimates
items.description: Ashok Leyland's total sales jumped by 5 percent YoY to 16,957 units in December
